Offscreen.name: logic_id
Offscreen.description: Renders a <input role="presentation" type="checkbox" /> as sibling before the Offscreen, which controls the visible state via CSS.

Offscreen.name: hidden
Offscreen.description: Controls when the Offscreen hides its child content.

Offscreen.name: state
Offscreen.description: Controls the visible state of the Offscreen whenever logic_id is set.

Offscreen.name: captive
Offscreen.description: Renders a ContextBackdrop as a sibling before the Offscreen, which becomes active whenever the visible state is active.

Offscreen.name: dismissible
Offscreen.description: Adjusts the sibling ContextBackdrop to be clickable, turning off the visible state when clicked.

Offscreen.name: alignment
Offscreen.description: Adjusts where the child content will be placed within the Offscreen along both axis.

Offscreen.name: alignment_x
Offscreen.description: (top/bottom PLACEMENT ONLY) Adjusts where the child content will be placed within the Offscreen along the horizontal axis.

Offscreen.name: alignment_y
Offscreen.description: (left/right PLACEMENT ONLY) Adjusts where the child content will be placed within the Offscreen along the vertical axis.

Offscreen.name: placement
Offscreen.description: Adjusts where the child content will be placed within the Offscreen along the vertical axis.

<script>
    import {
        Box,
        Button,
        ContextButton,
        Offscreen,
        Stack,
    } from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

<Button for="offscreen-preview" palette="accent">
    Open Offscreen
</Button>

<Offscreen
    logic_id="offscreen-preview"
    placement="top"
    hidden
    captive
    dismissible
>
    <Box palette="accent" padding="medium">
        <Stack
            orientation="horizontal"
            alignment_y="center"
            spacing="medium"
        >
            <ContextButton
                palette="light"
                variation="clear"
            >
                X
            </ContextButton>

            Well, hello there!
        </Stack>
    </Box>
</Offscreen>

data.render:
Offscreen

Offscreen is typically used for hiding content that'll slide into when actived via a button or something else.

Imports

<script>
    import {Offscreen} from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

Logic ID

NOTE: When you use a ContextButton within the Offscreen layout, it will automatically inherit the set logic_id via id Svelte Store.

You can make the Offscreen toggleable via the logic_id property, and then referencing that with a Button.

Hidden

NOTE: The REPL currently does not support viewport values. Resize your Browser instead.

Offscreen adds special handling for the hidden property, allowing you to instead customize when the child content is hidden offscreen or rendered normally.

Captive

You can optionally include a backdrop by passing via the captive property.

Dismissible

You can optionally have the Offscreen dismissible by clicking the backdrop via the dismissible property.

Placement

You can adjust which side your content is hidden on via the placement property.

Alignment

You can align Offscreen content via the alignment, alignment_x, and alignment_y properties respectively.
